content:
Diagnosis:		Hurthle cell carcinoma of thyroid

Management:		Total thyroidectomy March 2023
		Radioactive iodine ablation May 2023

Histology:		pT2N0M0 Hurthle cell carcinoma
		TERT promoter mutation negative

Current Situation:	Routine surveillance review

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up today. She remains well following completion of treatment last year. Her thyroid function is well controlled on levothyroxine 125mcg daily. Thyroglobulin remains undetectable at <0.1. Recent neck ultrasound on 15/4/24 shows no evidence of recurrence. Clinical examination today reveals well-healed thyroidectomy scar and no concerning features in the neck. She reports good energy levels and has maintained stable weight. The plan is to continue current surveillance with next thyroglobulin check in 3 months and follow-up appointment in 6 months.

cancer_timeline.value: Neck ultrasound shows no evidence of recurrence

patient_facts.value: Well-healed thyroidectomy scar and no concerning features in the neck
Good energy levels and maintained stable weight

status_updates.value: Stage II Hurthle cell thyroid cancer treated with surgery and radioiodine. Currently well with no evidence of recurrence on surveillance.
Continuing levothyroxine 125mcg daily with good thyroid function control
